intro: Vincetoxicum sui, commonly known as the European iron vine, is a deciduous shrub native to Central and Southern Europe. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. Vincetoxicum sui is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
